title: 109_hr6027
content: The Act titled "Volunteer Emergency Services Recruitment and Retention Act of 2006" allows for elective treatment of length of service award programs as eligible deferred compensation plans. The Act "Volunteer Emergency Services Recruitment and Retention Act of 2006" allows length of service award plans to be treated as eligible deferred compensation plans, with irrevocable election by the sponsor. The Volunteer Emergency Services Recruitment and Retention Act of 2006 allows length of service award plans to be considered eligible deferred compensation plans, with an irrevocable election by the sponsor. The term 'length of service award plan' refers to any plan that pays length of service awards to bona fide volunteers for qualified services performed, with volunteers defined as individuals who receive only reimbursement or a reasonable allowance for their services. The Volunteer Emergency Services Recruitment and Retention Act of 2006 allows length of service award plans to be considered eligible deferred compensation plans for volunteers who perform qualified services such as fire fighting, emergency medical services, ambulance services, and emergency rescue services. The maximum deferral amount is specified in the Act. The Act allows length of service award plans for volunteers in emergency services to be treated as eligible deferred compensation plans. Maximum deferral amount and distribution requirements are specified in the Act. The plan participant ceases to perform qualified services. Limitation on accruals for length of service award plans for volunteers in emergency services. The annual deferral limit for length of service award plans for volunteers is $5,000. For defined benefit plans, the limit applies to the actuarial present value of accrued awards, calculated using reasonable assumptions. The annual deferral limit for length of service award plans for volunteers is $5,000, with payment starting at the earliest age for unreduced benefits or the participant's current age. The Secretary will adjust the $5,000 amount for cost-of-living after December 31, 2007, following section 415(d) guidelines. Any increase not a multiple of $500 will be rounded down. The Internal Revenue Code is amended to exclude certain plans from deferring compensation. The effective date for these amendments is after December 31, 2006. The Internal Revenue Code is amended to exclude certain plans from deferring compensation after December 31, 2006. The Secretary of Labor will clarify that a length of service award program under the Internal Revenue Code is not an employee pension benefit plan under the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974.
